availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Morris (Franklin County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Ann E. Hampton Morris. Father of Richard Morris, Thompson P. Morris, John H. Morris. Physician in Franklin County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Physician in Frankfort in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, District 1, p. 28B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, District 1, p. 839.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, District 1, p. 221.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, Peaks Mill, p. 200B.
